page.title: 09COMBINED VILLAGE SCHOOLS
page.content: For over 100 years there was a school at Lea, for children from Lea and Garsdon, and one in Charlton with about 30 pupils each. In 1976, to the regret of many people in Charlton, the schools were combined into the one in Lea - called Lea and Garsdon. As Lea School only had one large schoolroom and a small side room it was necessary to build a new section onto it- two new double classrooms to take up to 120 children. Children from Charlton, Garsdon and Milbourne have to come in daily by special bus. At the moment there are just over 70 children. Two lady teachers share a double classroom for infants and young juniors. The Headteacher, with a part-time teacher one day a week, teaches the older children in the other double classroom.
